DOC.HEADLINE: U.S. state Tennessee inundated in floods, five die

TEXT.P: U.S. state of Tennessee was inundated in flood water Saturday, officials say at least five people have been reported dead.

Heavy rain have been flooding Tennessee since earlier that day. Two people were killed when their vehicle was caught by flood in Dover, about 120 km northwest of Nashville. Another was reported dead in Davidson County.

Two more people were reported killed later. One was reported dead in Williamson County and another in Carroll County, Tennessee Emergency Management spokesman Jeremy Heidt was quoted by CNN as saying.
The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a flood warning for areas of Middle Tennessee, including northern Rutherford County and Murfreesboro.

Heavy rainfall is causing "extremely dangerous" flooding in creeks and streams in Nashville, the National Weather Service said, noting between 150 to 240 mm of rain has fallen in 12 hours in the area. The floods have forced sections of Interstate 24 to be closed.
